description:
I Shoot Randy is a card game for 2 to 6 players ages 13 and up with average length of playtime between 10-15 minutes.

One player takes on the role of Randy and must survive the onslaught of attacks from the other players by countering the effects of their played cards.

If Randy's health is reduced to 0, the player in the role of Randy looses the game. However, if Randy survives all valid attacks from the other players, then he wins the game.

In all cultures there are mythical characters that protect people and help them to solve their problems. Those characters often take the human form with wings and we call them Guardian Angels or RAGAMI.

In this game, each player will play the role of a RAGAMI, winged human form, that travels around inside a city - the board. In this city, there are always people with problems, with their own internal conflicts, that need your help. There are also holy men and demons that can help or oppose to solving these conflicts.

The objective of the game is to achieve the highest possible number of Virtue Points (VP). There are several ways to get VP, and consequently there are several strategies one can follow to win the game: solve conflicts, cause demons to disappear, help other RAGAMI, to be the RAGAMI who has solved the highest number of conflicts, etc.

But helping people to solve their conflicts is what worths more VPs, and for this you need to have Points of Strength. As many as the strength of the conflict you're trying to solve, which can go from 1 to 6. There are several ways to get Points of Strength: white cubes, cards, holy men, the help of another RAGAMI, or a die.

There are Action Dies (which allow to execute a certain number of actions, and it's placement will be made by the last player in the turn order) and there are Action Cards (that may be acquired during the game). In his play, Player can do one of the following actions: move his RAGAMI, move the holy men and the demons, pick cards or solve conflicts.

Game ends in the turn when the places of conflicts ends or when a player hit's the 30 points score mark.

Game to 2 to 4 players, 10 years up, 60 - 90 min.

OverviewFor The Win is an abstract strategy game in which each player gets ten tiles, two of each character representing Monkeys, Zombies, Pirates, Aliens, and Ninjas.  The objective is to connect five (or more) of one's tiles, including at least one of each type, together (sides and corners count).  Additionally, all five (or more) tiles must be face-up, or unactivated.  The game ends immediately when a player achieves this goal.  Each character type has a specific ability to help you toward the objective.
  
				
				
					GameplayPlayers take turns using either 1 or 2 actions within 5 action rounds.  Once one player's actions are consumed for a round, the other player(s) get to use any of their remaining 5 actions at once.  Judicious action management is key; if one budgets one's actions wisely, one can play several actions in a row for game-winning combinations.  The available actions are as follows:


      Add a tile to the Grid
      Move one of one's tiles
      Refresh or flip a tile face up
      Shove a tile or column/row of tiles
      Activate an ability (the chosen tile turns face down; see below)


				
				
					Characters & abilities
    Alien — The Alien uses her tractor beam to pull any tile in the Grid to a space that is adjacent to her. 
    Monkey — The mischievous Monkey uses a banana peel to flip over all of the tiles it is touching. 
    Ninja — The sneaky Ninja can move from his current spot to any other unoccupied space in the Grid.
    Pirate — The Pirate uses his trusty cannon to blast an adjacent tile to any unoccupied space in the Grid.
    Zombie — The Zombie can infect any adjacent tile. The infected tile is removed from the Grid and replaced with a Zombie tile that has not yet been added to the Grid. If all of the Zombie tiles have already been added to the Grid, the Zombie may choose one adjacent tile and deactivate it (that is, flip it face down).

A game of rampage, you take control of a Kaiju Monster and score points by rampaging the city.
This game is a print and play game for 2 to 4 players from 4 to 104 years old.
All you need are some D6. The first player of the turn throw some D6, and picks one to move his kaiju monster, if the monster ends in a square with a building, it's a rampage ! The building is destroyed. The next player picks one of the remaining D6 and so on... The next turn, the player to the left becomes the first player.
When all the building are destroyed, each player scores one point for one building destroyed by his monster. Players with the higher scores are the winners.

"Discover the World" in English
Trivia game with questions about a nature.
You must answer correctly to advance on the game board and collect all the profit from the first part. A question is read aloud along with three possible answers, the players put in their opinion, the correct prediction chip face down on the table. Who has been right moves on the board in front of a field may turn around the chip and win the corresponding part. For higher income parts players  have to move higher by answering further questions, but falls back on the base part with a wrong answer. Who first had all the pieces turned on the colored side wins.

"Discover the nature" in English
Trivia game with questions about a nature.
You must answer correctly to advance on the game board and collect all the profit from the first part. A question is read aloud along with three possible answers, the players put in their opinion, the correct prediction chip face down on the table. Who has been right moves on the board in front of a field may turn around the chip and win the corresponding part. For higher income parts players  have to move higher by answering further questions, but falls back on the base part with a wrong answer. Who first had all the pieces turned on the colored side wins.

4049: The galaxy hums with prosperity and peace two millennia after the dawn of space travel. But as mankind and its neighbors colonized the stars, the burgeoning need for resources was apparent. One by one, new geological discoveries revolutionized terraform, construction and energy technology. The sub-temperature properties of the mineral Ice-9 allowed life-giving water to flow on uninhabitable planets. Crystallized Cobalt was accidentally found to be incredibly strong, resistant to extreme pressure. And a single chunk of Deuterium could power a sprawling metropolis for a month!

As a plucky entrepreneur you must explore the edges of space searching for precious minerals. Will you buy the fastest ship in the sector or hire the best pilot in the galaxy? Purchase the latest state-of-the-art gadgets, invest in planetary refineries, or pay off your rising debt? The cargo you haul could be worth fortune, so grab your helmet and suit up! The cosmos and a mountain of credits call!

In Starship Merchants, each player runs a fledgling corporation looking to stake a claim in the lucrative mining business. Player will buy starships, explore the galaxy and deliver cargo for interstellar credits, all the while expanding their operations.

Starting at the shipyard and ending at the dock, players will move clockwise around the four quadrants on the board to complete an entire Business Cycle. During each turn, a player either performs one action at the current quadrant or advances to the next, performing an action there. As players take actions or advance they spread apart across all four quadrants while completing individual Business Cycles.

The Shipyard is where you can buy a speedy scout or a heavy load bearing tug. The Market is where Gear, Pilots, Refineries, and claims can be purchased. In the belt, starships are run by spending energy points to explore, pickup mines, or fly to another destination. The final quadrant is the Dock where delivered cargo is traded for credits.

A player that ends his turn at the Dock with 100+ credits can declare the Final Run, ending the game. But after completing the Final Run, the player with the most credits wins!

Five games for the price of one (and that one is free!).

NanoGames contains five business card sized games.

- Battle Lines: Destroy the enemy and invade his base.
- Business Card Derby: Destroy your opponent's car before he destroys yours.
- Elbow Room: Place and slide your pieces to create a path from your base to your opponents.
- Jump-n-Spin: Get across the board by jumping over your own counters, or swapping places with your opponent's.
- The Lineup Shuffle: Create a line of four counters be sliding in from any edge.

Download the file and print on cardstock.  Cut the two     sides apart and glue together with the Blue and Red ends lined up.  Cut the pieces from the ends and you are ready to play.  Each NANOgame is fully self contained, with all the counters and rules you need.  I recommend #2 coin envelopes for storage, to keep all the pieces together.

A Faulkner party game.

Each guest at your party is given a card with 24 cryptic clues about various types of tree.

Example
Clue: A Joiner's Tool
Answer: A Plane tree

The participant who gets the most correct answers during the evening, wins.

Das Kindergarten-Wörterspiel: Fahrzeuge

is a cooparative game for the languange training with childs from 3 to 6 years (with the help of one adult).

Ole, Marie and Zeki want to drive within Dad car to the zoo. And you can come along! While you drive around the board you have to achieve some challenges. The field on which the car is show which kind of challenge you get. If you were succesfull you gain one card. It is the goal to get 9 cards before the ample turn to red.

The Challenges are around story-telling, Memory and roleplay.

(user summary)

Das Kindergarten-Wörterspiel: Tiere

is a cooparative game for the languange training with childs from 3 to 6 years (with the help of one adult).

Together with zookeeper Tim you having a nice day at the zoo.
While you going to through the zoo you have to achieve some challenges. The field on which Tim stands shows you which kind of challenge you get. If you were succesfull you gain one card. It is the goal to get 9 cards before the zoo closes.

The Challenges are around story-telling, Memory and roleplay.

(user summary)

A plastic board and 4 plastic foorballers are attached to handles. They work exactly the same as a pinball machine. Both players try to swing their footballers so that they can 'kick' the ball towards the opponent's goal.

The winner is the one who scores the most goals.

A football related target game. The target has 3 holes in it and a goal. The idea is to get the football into one of these scoring areas. You get 5 points if you get it past the goalkeeper, and 10, 15 and 20 respectively for the circular holes.

The mode of getting the ball to the target is to use the footballer provided. His leg is attached to a spring so you can lever it backwards and then let go. If you are lucky, you might score some points. I expect a lot of practice is required.

The target says '50 UP' so I assume the first player to score 50 points, wins.

There are 32 cards with 2 questions and 3 answers for both questions in this game.
Player gets a card if he has answered both questions correctly.  Whoever has the most cards at the end of the game wins.

Figure 5 cards face up and one for each category is determined. Then a letter uncovered and away you go. Each category must be an appropriate word to be found. Once the first player has to find an appropriate word to all categories he calls wise guy and all others must immediately stop writing.
If you're thinking: Urban-rural River, which is quite correct.5 cards are turned so they are face up and each get a category applied to.
Now one letter is to be uncovered and away you go. For each category the players find an appropriate word that begins with this letter, the words are to be written down. Once the first player finds an appropriate word for all categories he shouts : SCHLAUMEIER and the other Players must immediately stop writing.

Wer findet als Erster die richtigen Wörter?

Text from the Cover

From the game's website:

Travel Scavenger Hunt is a great new kids road trip game. To play, each player takes 5 cards and tries to locate various roadside objects. Players may have to find a stop sign, a pickup truck, a license plate with the letter Z, and many others. In addition, several funny "Hear It", "Smell It", and "Feel It" cards encouarge kids to use all their travel senses by listening for sounds, feeling for bumps, and sniffing for scents.

Travel Scavenger Hunt is the ultimate boredom beater and the perfect passenger for your next family roadtrip adventure.

Spook is a game that can be played with the Series: Shibumi game system. It uses the 4×4 board, 15 red, 14 black, and 1 white ball.

				
				
					RulesThe board (the haunted castle) starts empty.

A Visit to the Haunted Castle

Two players, Red and Black, take turns placing one ball of their colour either on an empty board hole or on a 2×2 platform. Starting with Red the pyramid is built up until in the last turn Black places the white ball (Spooky the ghost) on top.

Then Red makes the first move of the second phase of the game.

The Getaway
(To be played in candlelight.)

On their turn a player must either


     remove a ball (of any colour) to drop Spooky or
     remove a free ball (of any colour) which is orthogonally adjacent to Spooky and move Spooky there. If possible this move may be repeated arbitrarily removing additional balls of the same colour.


Only if no move is available then


     if Spooky is isolated he must be placed orthogonally adjacent to any ball on the board or on a platform,
     otherwise one unpinned ball of the opponent must be removed (a ball drop may occur),
     only if there are no unpinned opponent balls, the active player must pass his turn.


As usual, pinned balls (supporting more than one ball) may not be removed.

Aim

The player who has no more balls of their colour on the board wins the game.

Become a hockey team manager. Your goal is to create a strong team roster. To accomplish this, You have been given a specific amount of money. Think carefully about every bid You make. How much really is every player worth? Bid too much and You risk losing everything, bid too little and someone else will get this player. Because there are other managers biding for the best players.

"Lissy Around the horse" in English
Players have 3-6 cards in hand depending on the number of the players. The first player reads the question and answer choices and his/her left neighbor answers -
if it was correct, then the second question asked, is this also answered correctly, the neighbor gets the card.
If it was incorrect the next player may risk with card answering this question.
If somebody runs out of cards in his/her hand, game ends and the player with the most collected cards wins.

Lilly the Witch conjures up animals into the nursery and the player must find the correct counter-spell to let the animals disappear before the parents come home. The animal cards are laid out in a 5 x 5 square and there are witch figure in front of four rows. You take one of the characters, places them in front of the free row/column, revealing the cards and if he/she can disapear any animal he takes card. 
If there is a empty row/column in this game, player with the most animals wins

From the Designers:
You are twisted.  I can’t believe you actually want to put these adorable kittens in a blender! I guess that’s none of my business. Maybe you’re more of a dog person. Sure, kittens are curious by nature, but when they get in a kitchen full of dangerous appliances, it is up to you to save them.

This fast-paced card game has players working to save all of their own kittens before the unthinkable happens. But sometimes the only way to save your precious litter of kittens is to let those curious little cats learn the lesson of why you should never play in a Blender!

According to the box: A portion of the proceeds will be donated to a no kill cat shelter.

Objective:
Save your kittens and send your opponents' kittens to The Blender.

Setup & Play:
Put the game box top on the table, open-side up and place the oversized Blender card inside, face-up: that's The Blender. Place the oversized Box card face up in the base of the box: that's The Box. Leave a little space between The Blender and The Box: that's The Counter.  Assign each player a Kitten color (red, green, blue or yellow), shuffle the deck, deal each player 6 cards and it's time to start saving adventurous kittens.

On each turn, players play two cards and then draw back up to 6. Kitten cards may be played into The Blender, The Counter or The Box.  All other cards are played face up in front of the player so that all players can see which cards have been played.

Players can play Kitties on the Move to move kittens to or from The Blender, The Counter or The Box; the number on the card specifies the number of kittens that can each be moved 1 space. Playing a Blend card will destroy the kittens currently in The Blender, save the kittens in The Box, and move the kittens on The Counter into The Blender unless countered by another player's Blend "Pulse" card.

Players can move kittens around with other cards as well. Kittens in the Blender moves all of the kittens on The Counter or in The Box to The Blender. With These Cats in the Blender a player can move all cats of a chosen color from The Counter and The Box to The Blender. Kittens in the Box moves all kittens in The Blender or on The Counter to The Box, while Cats on the Counter moves all the kittens in The Blender or The Box to The Counter.

Total chaos reigns when the Dog's in the Kitchen as each player gives her hand to the player in the direction indicated on the card.

The game ends when all 16 of the Blend cards have been played. Saved kittens are worth 2 points each, blended kitties cost 1 point each. Highest score wins.

Contents: 1 oversized Blender card, 1 oversized Box card, 110 playing cards (64 Kittens: 16 in each of 4 colors - red, green, blue and yellow; 18 Kitties on the Move: 6 of each number; 16 Blends: 8 Regular Blend & 8 Blend Black; 4 Dogs in the Kitchen: 2 left & 2 right; 2 Kittens in the Blender; 2 Your Cats in the Blender; 2 Cats on the Counter; 2 Kittens in the Box), rules.

World of dogs
Which is the fastest dog in the world? Where the Cocker Spaniel gets its name? Here, players learn amazing facts about the most popular dog breeds.

There are 2 questions in each card with 3 answers for each questions. The winner is whoever can answer most questions correctly and thus can collect the most cards.
If the current player answers incorrectly the next player may risk with one of his collected card to answer it.

Contents:

     32 large format cards with color photos

"Wonders of nature" in English
The cards are divided into eight habitats: forests, lakes, rivers, mountain rain forests, savannas, steppes, deserts. 
The habitats have different frame colors for clarity. For each habitat, there is one card each of the following five groups, ie a total of 5 cards: mammals, birds, amphibians and reptiles, spiders and insects, and plants. The aim of the game is to win by correctly answering the questions, all five cards of a habitat. For each question there are three possible answers,

"Adventure horse" in English
When and why do horses neigh? What does a horse express when it strikes violently with its tail? Plenty of fun and eye-opening facts about horses.

There are 2 questions in each card with 3 answers for each questions. The winner is whoever can answer most questions correctly and thus can collect the most cards.
If the current player answers incorrectly, the next player may risk with one of his collected card to answer it.

Contents:

     32 large format cards with color photos

"Unbelievable, but true!" in English
The cards are divided into eight habitats: forests, lakes, rivers, mountain rain forests, savannas, steppes, deserts. 
The habitats have different frame colors for clarity. For each habitat, there is one card each of the following five groups, ie a total of 5 cards: mammals, birds, amphibians and reptiles, spiders and insects, and plants. The aim of the game is to win by correctly answering the questions, all five cards of a habitat. For each question there are three possible answers,

"Puzzles, records, sensations" in English
Trivia game on nature, on each card there are four questions, each with three possible answers, the players put chips on one of three answers and place their bet on any of the three betting cards with the corresponding response of the habitat. 
The one who relies on an incorrect answer loses his chips. The players who have bet on the correct answer will receive back the double bet.

Following Dewey's naval victory, US Officials negotiated with Spain over the surrender of the Philippine capital, Manila, while simultaneously negotiating Filipino independence with Aguinaldo. When US forces occupied Manila, Aguanildo's own larger, and initially better armed veteran force squared off with McKinley's expeditionary force. There followed four years of "official hostilities" (Guerrilla activities dragged on for more than a decade after McKinley declared end to the war). Hostilities raged across the central island of Luzon and several other major island. After Aguinaldo's capture, his regular forces melted into the bush and US troops faced its first major guerrilla war in the Pacific. As with later foreign adventures, it was not a popular war at home.

Amigos and Insurrectos is an area movement game for two players (a US and a Filipino player). Three scenarios will be offered: an eight turn - STAND UP FIGHT, represents the clash of regular forces; an eight turn - INTO THE BUSH, representing the guerrilla phase of the conflict, and a 15 turn CAMPAIGN GAME, combining both. Regular forces will be represented on the regimental level. Abstract jungle movement will be available through guerrilla movement boxes and movement between islands will be possible though trans-island boxes. Originally designed as a Card-Driven game, random historical events will occur based on objective and turn based triggers. Victory will be based on a point swing track that in the extreme, could see Filipino collapse or US withdrawal. This is a topic shown very little attention in the gaming hobby. Luckily, Olivier has seen fit to feature it in the upcoming issue #11 of BATTLES MAGAZINE.

Objective: be the first to gain 8 different coloured chips 
 - acting by turn -
due to (limited) no. of meeples you have to build teams if more than 6 players are participating
roll the die, move your meeple - landing on a coloured space (outer ring only) your left neighbour has to draw a (colour corresponding) card and challenges you with a question - appropiate your previous roll ==> '6' = free choice - out of following terms:
miscellaneous, history & politics, nature/enviroment, heaven & earth, technique & science, stort/games, fairy tales & sagas (incl. movies, music, riddles), arts & culture;
if your answer is correct you may throw the die again.

The message in this educational game is "Stay safe on the roads".

See who can be first to visit the library, school, friend's house and post office by crossing the roads safely. This will help build awareness of road safety, in particular, how and where to cross roads.

Objective:
gain the largest amount/value of coins stored in treasure chests
 - acting by turn - 
coins (gold, silver, copper) are going to be distributed randomly into treasure chests - 6 per chest 
chests are going to be stapled (start position)
throw the die - now you may distribute/split rolled number on one or more chests to move with: if you succeed placing the very last moved chest on a space showing the same colour:
open the chest picking out the topmost coin 
forming gaps in between chests is not allowed, they must touch at least another one;  
game ends if chests are empty:
counting coins: gold 10, silver 5, copper 1 point(s)

Grunt is a warfare card game using a board to depict 6 combat areas where Grunts (infantry) engage in combat.

The 6 combat areas depicted on the board (Town, Woods, Ruins, Hills, Swamp, and Fields) affect combat potential dependng on equipment and attack types used. Players take turn drawing and playing cards. Types of cards are: Black (Action) cards, Red (Explosives) cards, Green (Strike) cards, Orange (Equipment) cards, and Blue (Special Defense) cards.

Black Action or Green Strike cards are played hidden and take effect only on the next turn. This is done to simulate the time it takes to perform combat manoeuvres. Orange Equipment and Red Explosives cards must be played immediately when drawn. Blue Special Defense cards can be played at any time.

Play proceeds until resources (the main deck of cards) have been exhausted. The player with the most victory points is the winner.

(from Compass games website :)

The Battle of Medina de Rioseco, 14 July 1808, was fought during Napoleon’s War in Spain between two Spanish Armies under the commands of General Joaquín Blake and General Gregorio García de la Cuesta, and Marshal Jean-Baptiste Bessières in which the Spanish force was defeated after a closely fought, but determined assault by the French.

Medina de Rioseco was the sole French triumph in the initial invasion of Spain, which failed to seize the country, ultimately requiring a fresh campaign by the Grand Armée under the command of Napoleon himself to (temporarily) secure Spain.

Medina de Rioseco is the fifth game in the Eagles of the Empire series, and is a stand-alone add-in battle to Spanish Eagles (Talavera, 27th and 28th of July 1809, and Albuera, 16th of May 1811.) and is completely playable by itself. Medina de Rioseco features both a historical and alternative battle that allows players to recreate the engagement as it was fought or to bring in additional Spanish forces available but not present at the battle.

Lassos & Longhorns is a cooperative dice game where players work together to drive a herd of cattle north to the rail station. By balancing the speed at which they travel, the weight of the herd, and the health of the cowboys, players race competitors to be the first to Wayward Falls to sell their cattle for the highest price. But Butch Montgomery's gang of cattle rustlers, as well as the terrain, weather, and wild animals, aren't going to make it easy for them.

Lassos & Longhorns uses simple, push-your-luck mechanics, to allow for one to four players to work together on the cattle drive. The game is free to download over on the Corvid Games website.

Game description from the publisher:

In Fortress America, the United States must defend itself from three deadly invading armies: the Asian People's Alliance from the West, the Central American Federation from the South, and the Euro-Socialist Pact from the East. Players take on either the role of the United States, struggling to protect itself from foreign threat, or the role of one or more of the invading armies, fighting battle after battle to acquire important territories.

If the invading forces claim enough U.S. cities, America's defense is broken and the nation falls. But if the United States can protect its cities for long enough, the invading forces fail to uproot America and their incursion is ended.

Fortress America is played over several rounds in which each player musters his forces, moves into enemy-controlled territories, and engages in fierce firefights. But depending on whether you're the U.S. player or one of the Invaders, your play experience and general strategy will be entirely different. The U.S. must efficiently wield its colossal lasers, the ultimate weapons of mass destruction, in its own defense. What's more, as U.S. hovertanks, helicopters, bombers, and infantry are destroyed and removed from the map, a steady supply of American guerilla fighters spring up to defend their homeland. The U.S. player is surrounded and alone, and must do his best to fend off advances on three fronts in a series of tense battles.

The Invaders, on the other hand, must remain constantly aggressive. Their objective is to collectively capture 18 of 30 major U.S. cities, and to do so, they must apply early pressure before the U.S. has a chance to react, and keep the pressure constant. To complicate the Invaders' mission, their armies do not receive additional reinforcements, so they must make optimal use of the forces at their disposal. Through a series of nail-biting battles that use a unique dice-based combat system, each player will maneuver his dwindling armies to secure his objective. But can America be stopped, or will a failed invasion only compel them to tighten their military grip on the world.

Changed in this edition:


     Custom combat dice, debatable if better than normal dice.
     A ten-turn timer gives the U.S. player an additional path to victory: outlasting the invasion.
     A "Captured City" track lets all players see, at a quick glance, how close they are to victory or defeat.
     A few city locations have been removed, and others added, to create a different (possibly more balanced) play experience.
     A deck of variant cards for the Invader players has been added to use as a rules option (equal to 1-2 balance levels).


Reimplements:

    Fortress America (1986)

In the 80’s, a game company called Tendino created a revolutionary game console called Tendino Entertainment System (TES). Your company, 8-bit Inc, is one of the many companies trying to make the best games for the system and compete with them in the Game Prix Award (GPA).

This is a solo game where the player becomes the manager of 8-bit Inc. The player's job is to manage workers to create game points in graphics, sound, and programming by distributing 3 rolled dice (3D6) on workers. The more dice the player puts into a worker the more game points he will create and the better the game will become. Some workers are better than others.

The player also manages money and hires more workers by using the rolled dice. At the end of summer, the player must pay the workers wages (or lose them) and must compete in the Game Prix Award against other companies.

A word game. The pieces have both letters and black squares on them. The objective is to use all your tiles by making a correct Crossword. The player wins if he has used his last tile.

It can be played as a puzzle or it can be played competitively.

The box claims:
A Boon to the Sick
Days of Amusement
Entirely New and Novel
A 'Service' Favourite
186 tiles

The 'Service' reference probably means the game was published within the years 1939 to 1945 (World War II).

Objective:
collect 5 chips before you are allowed answering the final questions
 - acting by turn -
determine difficulty level first 
level one: give 1 correct answer for 1 question (5 times out of 5 different terms); level two: 2 correct answers for 2 questions ...; level three: 3 correct answers...  
roll the die, move your meeple, draw appropiate (colour) question or event card, follow instructions if you land on a space with a symbol.. if you had bad luck even back to starting point.
As soon as you've acquired 5 chips reaching target spaces you are protected - now you only have to find the correct answer(s) for the final question(s)

The game where is mixed football, dice rolling and trivia.
There are 10 footballers and 1 goalkeeper on the big game board for both players. Player rolls 4 dice on his turn. He may move his footballers as many squares indicated on 2 usual dice.
There are yellow or red card on one side of the 2 other dice.
If yellow card is rolled player's opponent draws yellow card and asks a question about Estonian football (soccer). If current player answers correctly he may continue his turn.
If he answers uncorrectly he misses the turn.
If red card is rolled player must remove one of his footballer from the game.

Player who scores most at the end of the game hitting the goals is the winner.

From the publisher:
This is a dice game, that combines trivia, football (not American "football") and dice luck.
Game goes by the rules of football and also gives advantage to the player who has more knowledge about Estonian national football team.
Each player tries to score goals, by going by the game board instructions, while each correct answer will give you another chance to hit a goal.

The objective is to locate six items that will enable to transorm Star pony into a unicorn.
49 cards are laid out face down on the game board, and the stall is being prepared. Plyer roll the dice and move either horizontally or vertically and in the target field he may uncover an adjacent tile. Player may continue her turn if she opens an item she doesn't have yet, but if she opens Buddy the dog she loses everything opened this turn.

Who has 6 different items and find also a stall cards may try to open the barn and win the game.

Les Maréchaux (The Marshals) is an operational wargame designated to simulate campaigns led by French marshals and generals of French Revolution and 1st Empire, when Napoleon was not directly acting on the theater of operations.

The game includes two scenarios:
- "Junot 1808" related to general Junot's campaign in Portugal against Wellesley, during summer 1808.
- "Soult 1809" related to marshal Soult's campaign in Portugal against Wellesley, during winter and spring 1809.

Players are moving divisions and brigades on a "point to point" map. They have to deal with supply, forced march and to prepare battles. The leaders of each army have a key role in coordinating actions.

The game includes:
- one A3 map for Soult's campaign; 
- one A4 map for Junot's campaign;
- 108 die-cut counters;
- independent rules and scenarios booklet.

Available with French rules, but English rules can be downloaded from Vae Victis or Designer's website.


The second game in the series is Les MarÃ©chaux II: Dupont 1808 â€“ Victor 1811 â€“ Suchet 1813 with three campaigns in Spain.

Sheltie and the other ponies escape and the players try to catch them. In order to retrieve as many ponies on the paddock, you need luck, courage and the right spin with the spinner.

The top card is revealed, the player spins the spinner and press down the edge of the roundabout before the roundabout even touched the table. Is the subject form the card is touched the next card is revealed and player may continue her turn but if the sucject is not touched she loses all cards revealed this turn. Sheltie acts as a wildcard.

Player with the most cards revealed = ponies catched at the end of the game is the winner.

From Publisher Website:

Abstractables is the fast-paced, creative thinking, word guessing game where you try to get your team to correctly guess a word or phrase by arranging and interacting with simple shapes before the time runs out.

Do you know what a cow looks like? Of course you do, but can you design one with basic shapes? And get your team to guess it correctly? And do it all in 60 seconds while your teammates are screaming hilariously wrong answers at you? Welcome to ABSTRACTABLES!

With 2000 words and phrases from 8 categories, including animals, people, locations, food, sayings, motions, objects and entertainment, the possibilities for fun for the whole family are endless and the replay value incredibly high. You simply roll the die, draw a card, and start moving the pieces. It’s so fun and easy, anyone can play. Bring Abstractables to your next family gathering or game night and watch the hilarity ensue!

It levels the playing field. Not artistic, don't worry, you don't need to draw anything. Just move the pieces to form the shape to communicate the word or phrase to your team.

Abstractables contains 3-layer European Birch hardwood pieces, category cards with over 2000 words or phrases, a one-minute timer, and an 8-sided category die.
Simple spin and move game from the mid-1950's from the Whitman Company. Object is to feed animals of the game in order to score extra points.

Objective: collect as many bonus points as possible (finding fodder on your way back to the shed & getting oat)
 - moving by turn -
each player has to move his/her 3 horses back from the pasture to the shed
throw (better: flip) the die inside the cover, that it touches the edge: bouncing back you may move/act with your horse according the space(colour) the die ends up;
make up your mind: choosing a short route you will get less valuable fodder but you are safe (more or less) getting a dry space with oat ==> which is necessary that all the stuff you picked up along your way home does count

Party game of trivia questions.

Each guest or team is given a card with 36 questions on it. During the evening they are encouraged to fill in all the correct answers, or just guess the ones they don't know. When the host calls "Time", the guest or team with the most correct answers, wins.

A dice game for very young children. Player move animals along a path by rolling a colour dice (moving to the next square of the colour the dice is showing). Special dice envents are the butterfly (move to the same colour you are standing on) and the bug (moving backwards). The winning player of a run gets a chip, then the race starts againg. First player with 3 chips is winner.

"Back of the box" desciption: Little animals are walking along a path. The die shows red! The little dog can move onto the next red square... A game that encourages communication between toddlers and their parents.

40 illustrated cards. The cards are divided into four series designated by different colored borders and by an illustration in the upper left corner of either la Maison, le Chäteau, le Jardin, or le Moulin. Each series is further divided into cards illustrated with the same objects, i.e. a dog, a cat, a key, a door, a banner, a man, a woman, a young boy, and a mousetrap.

The object of the game appears to be to collect all the keys, all the doors, etc by asking other players for the cards you need, in a Quartet or Authors fashion

Cuttle is a two-player card game played with a regular deck of 52 playing cards. The aim of the game is to have at least 21 points worth of number cards on the table. During a turn a player can either take a card from the stock pile, play a card on table or play a card as a one-off effect. Almost all of the different ranks of cards have special effects, such as "remove all number cards from the table", "counter an effect just played", "take any card from the scrap pile", "see your opponents cards" etc.

The game is somewhat similar to Magic: the Gathering but likely much older. Pagat.com dates it to "the 1970s at the latest".

See also Control, Scuttle! and Wreck

Race Condition is a card game that allows competing players to modify a shared computer program represented by playing cards.

Game cards and counters are arranged on a table top to represent the order of and relationship between instructions, the current instruction, and the values of variables. Competing players take turns modifying the computer program until one of them achieves his or her objective of setting a variable to a particular value. Players accomplish their goals by appending instructions to the program, and by performing special actions such as inserting, deleting, or moving instructions. As the players modify the program, it advances, modifying variables and potentially moving players closer to or further from their objectives.

From the publisher:
Game made by a local travel agency to find about more about traveling in Europe.
Game is basic roll and move, with treasure collection and trivia. Each players goal is to travel to a location shown on the card they have. Game comes with a 104 pages rule book which contains info for each country destination.
Be the first to reach destination to win the game.

Game comes in the nice box shaped like a briefcase.

Object of the game is during the questions try other players
to answer forbidden words YES or NO. If somebody answer so
others must then quickly ring the bell to move their pawn on the gameboard if they are the quickest.

The winner is who gets there first with his character in the middle of the board.

Educational game made for schools to introduce 4 parts of the nature. Game is simple, just roll and move through the game board and collect knowledge.
On the way to the end, you must stop on card spaces and answer what it on the picture.

Also, the rule book is 76 pages and can be used as small RPG with d20 dice and a journey to the nature.
On they way you have to get out of swamps and make choices of roads and so on. Goal is still to reach the end, but this way the game is more educational than the regular way.

First one to reach the end is the winner.

Game was created as a part of a student program and was put together by over 50 student ideas.

Promotional game for bread. The game is about making bread.

Game is played on a Monopoly like game board, with outer track being the break making track and inner snake like track for getting points to reach next levels on your bread making track.

Game is played in turns and in the inner track. You move there according to dice rolls and do what the spaces say. Each time you reach red space, you can take next step on the bread making track and reading out loud, how the process is made.
Winner is the first player to finish the bread.

Objective: catch as many valuable fishes as possible before returning safely to fisherman's cottage
 - acting/moving by turn - 
roll the die, move according rolled number; ending on an 'A' marked space roll the die again  1-3 ==> bad luck; 4-6 lucky
sometime you may - if position is marked with 2 or 3 - try again.
Places are suitable for different sorts of fish - more or less valuable ==> see table 
you may also take a more risky decision: get a boat and reach very rich in fish position - but you can get lost, too;
game ends if last (surviving) player has returned to fisherman's cottage

This is two-player game that simulates the Battle of Yangxia after Wuchang Uprising during the Xinhai Revolution of 1911.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Yangxia

Gaming period is more than 40 days from late October to December 1. Gaming map covers three towns of Wuhan (Wuchang, Hankou and Hanyang). One player commands Revolutionary Army and the other player commands Qing Forces.

The game covers a operational land battle in Burma from January to May 1942. Each turn  covers half a month. The map covers Burma and neighboring areas such as China India and Thailand. One player commands Imperial Japanese Army and the other player commands the Allied Forces.
